id: R. P. Gustavo Le Paige Archaeological Museum
content:
R. P. Gustavo Le Paige Archaeological Museum is a museum located in San Pedro de Atacama, Chile. It houses a collection of about 380,000 pre-Columbian artifacts from the Atacame√±o culture. The museum is named after Jesuit missionary Father Gustavo Le Paige, who was its founder.
This museum belongs to the Catholic University of the North. It closed in September 2015 for refurbishment and redevelopment and reopened in late 2016.
